Title: Indonesian mutual funds classification using clustering method
Affiliations: Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Dewi Tamara, I., Binus Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Revina, S., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Mutual funds have existed since 1990 as an alternative investment in Indonesia. The objective of this research is to examine the existing classification of mutual funds database. The data of mutual funds is taken from Bloomberg through Portal Reksadana 2013 which covered 690 mutual funds. The existing classification consists of mutual funds fixed income (reksadana pendapatan tetap), equity (reksadana saham), money market (reksadana pasar uang) and structured (reksadana campuran). The existing financial attributes consists of the net asset value, percentage annualized return the last 6 months, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years and year-to-date. This paper uses K-means clustering to propose new classification of Indonesian mutual funds. The result reveals that mutual funds in equity and fixed income belong to its group. However, mutual funds money market is belong to mutual fund fixed income and mutual funds structures are identified to mutual funds equity. Furthermore, we find that in average 43% of Indonesian mutual funds are misclassified in accordance with their attributes. Finally, it is suggested to re-group the mutual funds into smaller classification, which has lower rates of misclassified mutual funds and possibility to achieve better performances in terms of its percentage annualized return. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
References: Tony, B., (2002) Journal of Targeting, Measurement and Analysis for Marketing, 10, p. 301; Danila, N., (2012) Asian Journal of Business and Accounting, p. 5; Das, N., (2003) Mutual Fund Classification Using K-Means Clustering Method, , 9th International Conference on computing in Economics and Finance, University of Washington, Seattle; Johnson, R.A., Wichern, D.W., Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis (1998) Prentice Hall; Kuo, R.J., Ho, L.M., Hu, C.M., (2002) Computers and Industrial Engineering, 42, p. 391; Marathe, A., Shawky, H.A., (1999) Advances in Quantitative Analysis of Finance and Accounting, 7, p. 199; Moreno, D., Olmeda, I., Marco, P., (2000) A New Look on Classification of Spanish Mutual Funds, , Working Paper Draft
